name: Milton Park Country House Hotel & Destination Spa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My Wife and I stayed at Milton Park for 2 nights, following our wedding at another venue in the southern highlands. We were under the impression we were staying at a 5 star venue, that was the reason we decided to go there, however once we arrived we found the place to be nothing like any 5 star hotel we have ever stayed at.
reviews.title: Self Appointed 5 Stars

likes.disliked: — every single thing was horrible, except the beautiful gardens

reviews.text: After parking our car several hundred metres from the entrance in the car park (no valet), I carried our bags to reception to check in. We were handed the keys to the room and told where to go (a 5 star hotel would show you to your room).
reviews.title: Attention to detail lacking

likes.liked: — Extensive mature gardens and sitting rooms which were part of the original house.
likes.disliked: — Poorly maintained rooms and mixed service from staff.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I then carried our bags on another lengthy walk down the cold hallways to our room. (Room 206)
reviews.title: One of a kind!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Upon entering, there was a bottle of Australian Sparkling Wine waiting for us in the room. However my wife had ordered Champagne and paid for champagne when the room was booked ($70).
reviews.title: Has the potential to be great....but falls short

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I were absolutely disgusted by the bathroom. There were broken tiles, tiles missing and horrific mould and mildew had over run the squalid, dank room. We proceeded to the reception again to complain, and to say that this place is not the 5 star hotel we had thought we had booked into. This was when we were told that Milton Park is in fact, "self appointed 5 stars", whatever that means.
reviews.title: Totally Relaxing

likes.disliked: — Reception - is a little odd and too far from the carpark

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the hotel for a night in early April 2008. The purpose of our visit was to check out the hotel and their full range of services in the lead up to our wedding which we were going to hold there in 2009.
reviews.title: Ok... but not fantastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel and the grounds are fantastic, the food in the restaurant was superb and the rooms were lovely. It is a long way from town and there isn't the standard high level of service you would expect from a 5 star place. Parking is a challenge, there is no one to show you to your room and the service at lunch was very slack. We didn't receive the "full treatment" that the other diners received, I'm not sure if it was because they were told we would be tasting for a wedding but you'd think they would offer a standard service to everyone.
reviews.title: Great Winter getaway from Sydney but lacking a few touches

likes.liked: — Restaurant and amazing massages (and I am a massage snob!)

reviews.text: Overall the service really lets down the place, when we were planning our wedding we were that they could do one thing on one day and then the next they couldn't. The coordinator while very nice is over worked and in the time it took for her to issue the quotation we orgainised the entire wedding in another location. So in summary if you can get a deal stay here, the grounds are amazing and the food great (we didn't try out the spa) but expect little from the service and you won't be disappointed.
reviews.title: A nice alternative...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My boyfriend took me to Milton park for our two year anniversary. We often escape the rat race of Sydney at weekends and our favourites are Tower Lodge (Hunter valley) and Lillianfels (Blue Mountains) but as we were impressed by the Milton Park website and wanted to try somewhere new so we went to spend a weekend there.
reviews.title: No Recommendations Here - Dramas Dramas Dramas

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was a very cold weekend in july so we were glad we had requested a room with a fire, the rest of the hotel was pretty cold and I imagine the rooms without fires would have been too. They didn't light the fires in the lounge area or bar until after 5-6pm (so there was nowhere warm to sit and have a cup of tea or read the paper- if we hadn't of had a fire in our room) the hotel felt very quiet and apart from a conference of about 20 people there only seemed a few other people staying there.
reviews.title: Simply the Best

aka: Milton Park Country House Hotel And Destination Spa
description: Milton Park Country House Hotel & Spa, the Southern Highlands leading luxury hotel, crowns its own private 300 acre estate. Considered by many to be the finest regional hotel in Australia, Milton Park offers luxurious accommodation, fine cuisine and impeccable service in an atmosphere of relaxed sophistication. The hotels facilities rival some of the greatest Country House Hotels of the World. Both American Express Travel & Gourmet Traveller Magazine have recently voted Milton Park amongst their top ten luxury escapes for 2009.
